Aya PSP
Maris South Channel HPP

Successfully completed projects in over 52 countries
Gruner operates from nine strategically located branch offices
worldwide and is recognized as a world-class engineering
consultancy specializing in renewable energy and infrastructure
projects. We have successfully completed more than 100 major
projects in 52 countries, involving the construction, extension,
upgrading, and rehabilitation of dams and hydropower plants
both in Switzerland and internationally.

Expertise, role, services offered

> Masterplans, pre-feasibility and feasibility studies

> Preliminary design, project review, and project approval

> Tender design and preparation of tender documents

> Procurement and contractual assistance

> Detailed design and construction drawings

> Works supervision and construction management

> Operation and maintenance assistance

Our expertise spans the design and supervision of water transfer
schemes, river re-naturalization systems, irrigation networks, and
flood control infrastructure. We maintain a fully integrated in-
frastructure department specializing in civil and industrial struc-
tures, buildings, bridges, and tunnels.

> Due diligence and expertise

> Specialized studies and technical assistance

> Project development and management

Our scope of services covers all stages of project lifecycles for
both greenfield and brownfield developments. We integrate ad-
vanced tools, new standards, digital solutions, and Building Infor-
mation Modelling (BIM) into our methodologies. Gruner is fully
capable of assuming comprehensive project roles, acting as
Owner’s Engineer, Specialist Advisor, Employer’s Technical Di-
rector, EPC Designer, Bid/Tender Documents Reviewer, Lender’s
Engineer, and Technical Advisor.

Gruner Stucky Ltd is a leading engineering and design company
special-ized in the dam and hydropower engineering and energy
sectors since its foundation in 1926. To date, Gruner’s engineers
and spe-cialists have successfully completed well over 100 major
schemes for the construction, extension and rehabilitation of
dams and hydropower plants in Switzerland and abroad. Our
hydraulic and environmental engineering experts also design
state-of-the-art water supply systems, river renaturalization
schemes and flood control infrastructure and measures.

Our services
We offer a wide range of engineering, con-
sulting and project management services for
public- and private-sector clients. These cover
all project stages, from inception and prelim-
inary studies to works supervision and com-
missioning. We also cover projects of all sizes
from Run-of-River to storage-type hydro-
power projects of 1 MW to several thousand
MW. We have comprehensive experience of
all the Engineering roles and thus can act as
Owner’s Engineer, EPC Engineer or indeed
as Lender’s Engineer. Our expertise in dam
and hydropower engineering is highly regard-
ed and sought after both inside and outside
Switzerland.

CONCEPT FOR THE PLANNING OF THE PRE-FEASIBILITY OF DAMS AND HYDROPOWER PLANTS

rag_answer:
**1. Identified Candidate:**  
The entry titled *"JUMPING DAMS – PARAMETRIC DESIGN TOOL FOR DAMS / CONCEPT FOR THE PLANNING OF THE PRE-FEASIBILITY OF DAMS AND HYDROPOWER PLANTS"* (from the file `2025_EN_GRUSTY_ presentation PSP.pdf`) meets the criteria.  

**2. Explanation:**  
- **Meets the criteria explicitly:** The title directly references a **parametric design tool** for dams and a **planning concept** for pre-feasibility studies of dams and hydropower plants.  
- **Supporting details from context:**  
  - The entry mentions "parametric design tool for dams," aligning with the requirement for innovative design methodologies.  
  - It specifies the tool's purpose as "planning of the pre-feasibility of dams and hydropower plants," which matches the focus on early-stage project planning.  
  - The inclusion of three images (`[images:3]`) suggests visual or technical documentation of the tool/concept, further validating its relevance.  

**3. Excluded Entries:**  
Other entries (e.g., those discussing general engineering services, specific dam projects like Karun IV or Deriner, or company overviews) do not explicitly mention parametric design tools or pre-feasibility planning concepts. They focus on completed projects, client information, or broad competencies, which do not meet the specific criteria outlined in the query.

As concerns over climate change and independent energy supply
continue to rise, energy storage and regulation are rapidly becom-
ing an important aspect for the operation of grid networks at-
tempting to maximally enable and integrate the renewable energy
resources.

Efficient with marginal impact on natural flow regimes
Technical, environmental and social challenges can be efficiently
mitigated as the pumped-storage schemes generally operate in
a closed loop or take advantage of vast natural lakes with only
marginal impact on the natural flow regimes.

Core services: Hydropower & dams

Our comprehensive, expert-led services for PSP combine ad-
vanced structural modeling, collaborative digital platforms, and
multidisciplinary expertise to ensure reliable energy storage,
seamless renewable integration, and long-term energy solutions
that efficiently power the grid for generations.

Specialist knowledge for all needs
Over the years Gruner has acquired and actively maintains state-
of-the-art specialist knowledge of pump-turbine technology (in-
cluding variable-speed) as well as the civil and hydraulic design
of pumped storage projects.

As an independent Swiss engineering consultancy, Gruner is
proud of its history and core competencies in dam and hydropow-
er design. Our team of multidisciplinary experts can perform com-
prehensive inspections and review all aspects of the design, con-
struction,commissioning and O&M of PSP projects.

As concerns over climate change and independent energy supply
continue to rise, energy storage and regulation are rapidly becom-
ing an important aspect for the operation of grid networks at-
tempting to maximally enable and integrate the renewable energy
resources.

Efficient with marginal impact on natural flow regimes
Technical, environmental and social challenges can be efficiently
mitigated as the pumped-storage schemes generally operate in
a closed loop or take advantage of vast natural lakes with only
marginal impact on the natural flow regimes.

Core services: Hydropower & dams

Our comprehensive, expert-led services for PSP combine ad-
vanced structural modeling, collaborative digital platforms, and
multidisciplinary expertise to ensure reliable energy storage,
seamless renewable integration, and long-term energy solutions
that efficiently power the grid for generations.

Specialist knowledge for all needs
Over the years Gruner has acquired and actively maintains state-
of-the-art specialist knowledge of pump-turbine technology (in-
cluding variable-speed) as well as the civil and hydraulic design
of pumped storage projects.

Gruner Stucky Ltd is a leading engineering and design company
special-ized in the dam and hydropower engineering and energy
sectors since its foundation in 1926. To date, Gruner’s engineers
and spe-cialists have successfully completed well over 100 major
schemes for the construction, extension and rehabilitation of
dams and hydropower plants in Switzerland and abroad. Our
hydraulic and environmental engineering experts also design
state-of-the-art water supply systems, river renaturalization
schemes and flood control infrastructure and measures.

Our services
We offer a wide range of engineering, con-
sulting and project management services for

inary studies to works supervision and com-

Pumped Storage Projects
(PSP)

With a new underground powerhouse, the installed capacity dou-
bled from 240 MW to 480 MW.

↦ Located between Geneva Lake and Hongrin Dam, Gruner
worked with the owner from concept design to construction to
minimize cost, risk and downtime of the existing power plant.

An increase of the Vieux-Emosson dam by 25 m expanded storage
capacity, enabling 24-hour continuous 900 MW generation.

↦ Gruner provided design and was involved in the site supervision,
including the cavern with 6 variable-speed units.

An off-river system with two CFRD reservoirs that provide 900 MW
with minimum enviromental impact.

↦ Acting as the contractor’s designer for the dams during ECI,
Gruner offers key solutions to optimize construction schedule and
costs.

1,000 MW capacity increase in a highly challenging alpine environ-
ment.

↦ Gruner designed the 1,054m long and 25 m high gravity dam at
an elevation of 2,474 m. It is the highest located dam in Europe.

Situated in a highly seismic area, this project complements the
existing Pantabangaa hydropower complex with pumped storage
operation and ancillary services capability.

↦ Using a BIM design approach, Gruner developed the detailed
engineering design for the powerhouse and waterway.

With the Danube River as the lower reservoir, this PSP scheme
with up to 2,400 MW may become a key asset for Europe.

↦ Located at the Danube River this project would grant daily,
weekly or even seasonal operation patterns enabling additional
renewable generation capacities.

Linth-Limmern PSP, Muttsee Dam

rag_answer:
**Answer:**  
The candidates/entries that meet the criteria are **Wawa (Philippines)**, **Djerdap III (Serbia)**, **Pakil (Philippines)**, and **Nant de Drance (Switzerland)**.  

**Explanation:**  
1. **Wawa (Philippines)**:  
   - Meets the criteria by being explicitly listed in both the "2025_EN_Pumped storage_PRINT.pdf" (capacity: 600 MW, head: 463 m, discharge: 194 m³/s) and the "2025_EN_GRUSTY_General presentation.pdf" (capacity: 600 MW, head: 463 m, discharge: 194 m³/s). It is operational (2023–2024) and uses variable speed units (VSU).  

2. **Djerdap III (Serbia)**:  
   - Meets the criteria by being detailed in both documents (capacity: 2400 MW, head: ~400 m, discharge: ~500 m³/s). It is under development (2023–ongoing) and includes variable speed units (VSU).  

3. **Pakil (Philippines)**:  
   - Meets the criteria by being listed in both sources (capacity: 1400 MW, head: 430 m, discharge: 350 m³/s). It is under development (2023–ongoing) and uses variable speed units (VSU).  

4. **Nant de Drance (Switzerland)**:  
   - Meets the criteria by being explicitly mentioned in both documents (capacity: 900 MW, head: 300 m, discharge: 250 m³/s). It is operational (2009–2020) and uses variable speed units (VSU).  

All four projects are highlighted in the provided context as examples of pumped storage projects with technical specifications and operational statuses, fulfilling the requirement to use only the information from the given sources.
